cyclone.name: MICHAEL
cyclone.current_location: about 130 mi SSW of the western tip of Cuba
cyclone.trajectory: moving north through the Yucatán Channel, then accelerating northeast across the eastern Gulf toward the Florida Panhandle and continuing northeastward across GA–SC–NC before emerging off the Mid-Atlantic coast

weather_observation.impacted_coast: Initial strike expected along the northeastern Gulf Coast (FL Panhandle) with subsequent impacts spreading inland across GA, SC, NC and the Mid-Atlantic shoreline including Delaware
weather_observation.wind: Low-to-moderate chance (≤20%) of sustained tropical-storm-force winds by late Thursday into early Friday
weather_observation.storm_surge: No significant surge expected in Delaware Bay based on current inland-track guidance
weather_observation.rainfall: Bands of heavy rain Thursday–Friday could total 2–4 inches with locally higher amounts, producing ponding and terminal-yard flooding
weather_observation.other_hazards: Brief gale-force gusts on the Delaware River, reduced visibility, and possible river rise from upstream rainfall
